intro: Tetratelia tenuifolia var. maculatiflora, commonly known as the spotted-flowered tetratelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers with distinctive reddish or purplish spots. The leaves are typically narrow and elongated, arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. This variant is notable for its ornamental value due to its unique floral markings.
